Die Ermittlungen führen von den erhabenen Häusern der Reichen und Mächtigen hin zu den finstersten Absteigen, welche die Stadt zu bieten hat.

211657.name: Worldbreaker
211657.description:
(publisher blurb)

For decades, the Ordo Veritatis has fought the Esoterrorists: occult operatives bent on ripping apart the membrane between our reality and the demonic vortex of the Outer Dark.

Today, that threat becomes reality, as a barbaric ritual in an underground club touches off a series of coordinated assaults designed to break our world forever.

Written by Robin D. Laws, creator of GUMSHOE and the Esoterror setting, Worldbreaker brings Esoterror’s cosmic endgame center stage in a world-spanning campaign of high-stakes investigations. After a gore-spattered prologue, players choose from four harrowing interlocked scenarios they can tackle in any order—staking life, limb and mental stability against those who would destroy everything we know.

From caverns deep below Belize to an arms dealer’s warehouse in Transnistria, from Silicon Valley offices to haunted, rebel-held forests of Nigeria, your agents unravel the schemes of monsters both metaphorical and literal. Battle deconstructed animals, opportunistic demons, body-stealing parasites, and otherworldly PR agents. Put together the clues that lead to the conspiracy’s mastermind, and the most powerful and destructive Outer Dark Entity to ever squeeze through a hole between realms.

Can you keep the world unbroken? And how many agents will you lose along the way?

211658.name: The Black Hackzetteer (Volume 1, Number 2 - Aug 2016)
211658.description:
(publisher blurb)

In these pages you will find some useful and not-so-useful ideas for your Black Hack or compatible gaming sessions. Evereything from new classes, charts, tables, to short adventures will be included. Be warned, however, there is no set schedule of releases for this periodical and they will come out, shall we say, periodically.

211659.description: Каркассон. Наука и магия is the third collection of expansions for the game "Carcassonne". It consists of seven expansions: "The Flying Machines", "The Messengers". "The Ferries", "The Goldmines ", "Mage & Witch", "The Robbers" and set "The Corn Circles". To play him you need basic "Carcassonne" or "Carcassonne. Wheel Of Fortune"
211659.name: Carcassonne: Science and Magic

211660.name: The Black Hackzetteer (Volume 1, Number 3 - Oct 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Things that Creep and Crawl and Bump in the Night
211660.description:
(publisher blurb)

Welcome to the third issue of The Black Hackzetteer, a periodical for use with David Black's The Black Hack. In these pages you will find some useful and not-so-useful ideas for your Black Hack or compatible gaming sessions. Evereything from new classes, charts, tables, to short adventures will be included. Be warned, however, there is no set schedule of releases for this periodical and they will come out, shall we say, periodically.

211661.name: KRON
211661.description:
Spanish game based on a ficticional battle between the "Attack Group of KRON" and the "Omega Commando" of 'The Leader'.

Released by 'Star Play S.L.' Publisher at early '80s, this game probably combines the titles of "Krull" (1983) and "Tron" (1982) films and was another Sci-Fi game resulting of the great success of Star Wars Trilogy.

The game components are:

- 01x Rulebook
- 01x Quick-introduction sheet
- 01x Map representing outer space and a cosmic shuttle
- 14x Warriors (7 for each player) including The Leader / Kron
- 01x Six-Sided (D6) Dice
- 01x Dice Cup

They are 4 types of different troops:

- Heroes: Kron Strength 5 & El Líder - Strength 6
- Laser Gunner: The only one who can attack from far, but need to be his Hero in game to use it - Strength 1 / Shoot 4
- Android: The worst warrior type Strength 2
- Humanoid: The best in melee fight) Strength 4

How to play:

We have a space shuttle in the middle of the map. Each team, has 5 asterisks in the outer space. They are the starting point of their troops. The players will have 7 warriors, and they have to decide which 5 will start the battle. After it, the game secuence is: move (1 or 2 hexas) any of all of their troops, shoot with the gunners, melee attacks and call for reinforcements.

You can fight into the shuttle -there is an aditional asterisk on it that you can use for warriors entry after occupying the star point- or in the outer space, but you can´t cross the space ship except from the entrance / exit doors.

The player who conquest all the enemy's asteriks will be the winner.

211662.name: A Random Encounter (Issue 3 - Aug 2016)
211662.description:
(publisher blurb)

A Random Encounter is an RPG interview zine. Each issue explores one RPG creator, the games they play, the things they make and how they try to do both well.

Issue 3 of A Random Encounter looks at Patrick Stuart, writer of Deep Carbon Observatory, co-writer of the ENnie Award winning Maze of the Blue Medusa, and creator of the False Machine blog. We explore Patrick's imagination, his thoughts on games, his approach to game design and a lot more. As well as a super-sized interview, Issue 3 features outstanding art by Scrap Princess and Jeremy Duncan.

211663.name: Future Wars - (Issue 23)
rpgissuearticle: Looking at the Weapons of Battletech
Love Has No Place On The Battlefield
New Vehicle: Buzz Saw AC Carrier
211663.description:
Front Cover:
In this Issue: HEAVY MECHS

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211664.name: Gran March
211664.description:
From the introduction:

The government of Gran March most closely resembles a feudal monarchy. The ruler, known as the Commandant (His Most Resolute Magnitude, Magnus Vridanian currently holds the title), serves a five-year term and is elected by the nobility (10 Barons, 2 March Wardens, and a group of 100 hereditary nobles known as the Electors). The Knights of the March (now the Knights of the Watch) were responsible for the pacification of the area now known as Gran March, but the Knights are not as closely associated with the government as they once were and the Commandant is no longer always a member.

User summary:

This document served as a concise introduction to the Gran March for players involved in Living Greyhawk convention/tournament play. It includes character design suggestions.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211665.name: Into the Rushmoors
211665.description:
A Living Greyhawk Adventure for Gran March

From the introduction:

You are asked to brave one of the last wild areas of Gran March in order to retrieve an artifact of incredible historical significance. Are you up to the task?

An introductory Living Greyhawk adventure written for [first level] heroes.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211666.name: Caravan Duty
211666.description:
A Living Greyhawk Adventure for Gran March

From the introduction:

You have been hired (or assigned, in the cast of Army members) to guard a caravan of supplies traveling from Buxton's Crossing to Hochoch. Humanoid raids have been more frequent in the Dim Forest lately, so there is a good chance that you'll see some action.

This tournament [scenario] introduces many aspects of the Gran March region and is intended for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211667.name: Horse Play
211667.description:
A Living Greyhawk Adventure for Gran March

From the introduction:

Orcs are threatening the peace in the area near Carern, and heroes are needed to put things right. It's a good thing you happened to be in town.

This is a Gran March regional tournament and is intended for heroic characters of level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211668.name: Ruins of Velstar Keep
211668.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

There is a haunted ruin outside Hookhill that some adventurers are being invited to investigate.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211669.name: Under Siege
211669.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

A quick stopover in Fort Endurance turns into a longer stay than you imagined. The goblins are on the rise and it's up to you do do your part in stopping them.

Active military members may use Military Time Units to play this scenario.

A Gran March Regional scenario [for] characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211670.name: A Deadly Beginning
211670.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Humanoids have been spotted moving in number in the Lortmils. What can this mean for the people who live there?

An adventure for character levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211671.name: Lesser of Two Goods
211671.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Church of St. Cuthbert in Shiboleth is looking for a few noble souls with your talents to help them out in the Dim Forest. But what's this? Someone else seeks your help for the same purpose? It looks like somebody's going to be disappointed.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211672.name: Tears of Blood
211672.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The crowds that Richfest brings to Hookhill can conceal many a criminal or dastardly plot. While innocent folk celebrate, evil is afoot and it is up to you to stop it or thousands may die.

An adventure for character levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211673.name: Strange Deadfellows
211673.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The road past Fort Endurance must be expanded to support the war against the giants. Your assistance is required to make sure this dangerous project in the Dim Forest succeeds. A well-balanced party with good tactical skills is required.

For character levels 1 - 6; qualifies as military time.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211674.name: Fading Vision
211674.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Trouble in Carern, again. Raiders from the Dim Forest step up attacks - the Army spread too thin. Heroes envisioned may stem the tide. Something more sinister afoot?

A two-round adventure for self-motivated heroes of the March.

This adventure is recommended for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211675.name: The Festival of Bathilda
211675.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You are visiting a small village in Barony of Cavintus. You arrive just in time for the local festival of Bathilda. During the reenactment of the bravery of Bathilda, the person pretending to be the Paynim Chieftain is supposedly smothered. Unfortunately someone seems to have gotten carried away, and now someone will have to investigate a murder. Guess who's going to get stuck with the job?

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211676.name: Field Maneuvers
211676.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Someone is trying to undermine the control of the Army of Retribution in Hochoch. Can they stand their ground and help the Geoffites keep the only free city in Geoff? Or will they be forced back to the Gran March?

An adventure for military-oriented characters levels 3 - 8.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211677.name: Eyes on Orlane
211677.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Many civilians have disappeared along the roads leading to Orlane while other travelers claim to have narrowly escaped goblinoid attacks in these areas. Military command does not have the resources at this time to launch an investigation into these attacks. Indeed, the military forces in the area have had no recent encounters with goblins.

This scenario is intended for characters of levels 3 - 10.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211678.name: The Mines of Loras Ma
211678.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Many civilians have disappeared along the roads leading to Cragmor while other travelers claim to have narrowly escaped goblinoid attacks in these areas. Military command does not have the resources at this time to launch an investigation into these attacks. Indeed, the military forces in the area have had no recent encounters with goblins.

An adventure for characters [of levels] 3 - 10.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211679.name: Midnight Dawn
211679.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The 20th Battle stationed in Orlane has lost quite a few scouts in the last few days. The cavalry contingents of the 20th Battle are far away on patrol. Knight-Colonel Watcher Tark Obleron, Most Defiant Hydra, is requesting the activation of a small militia unit to assist in locating the missing scouts. Guess who "volunteers"...

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211680.name: The Free Band
211680.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A restful stop in the sleepy community of Foredge turns out to be anything but, as members of a nearby work gang begin to disappear. Are they deserters, or could the rumors be true? Is it a remnant of the force that laid siege to Orlane such a short time ago lurking in the Dim Forest?

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 10.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211681.name: Depth Perception
211681.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Foul deeds in the night... The severed hand of the Whispered One rises to strike at the heart of Gran March... Are you able to stop it?

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 10.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211682.name: The Patrol
211682.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Sometimes it's all about getting back alive.

This scenario is intended only for those who serve in the Gran March military (active duty, activated veterans, or foreign soldiers on detached duty).

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 10.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211683.name: Malficius Ex Malficius
211683.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

In which the characters attempt to discover the source of a mysterious storm plaguing the Barony of Shiboleth.

Characters should be suitable for extended operations in inhospitable terrain.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 10.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211684.name: Toecutter
211684.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Your help is needed on an important mission into the darkest corners of Hookhill. Stealth and subtlety are needed more than boldness and brute force, although there may be some head bashing before the day is out. Law enforcement types need not apply.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211685.name: Rotting on the Vine
211685.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Hospitalers need clever investigators to find one of their clerics, who may have been infected with the plague.

Military [time units] may be used for this scenario.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 10, and Part One in the “Shadow, Sun, and Sword” series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211686.name: A Night in Birnham Woods
211686.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A trip through the countryside takes a detour when adventurers are needed to solve a string of murders in a small town. Can they solve the crimes before more murders take place?

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211687.name: It Stalks the Night
211687.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

Premiere at Dragon Con

From the introduction:

A simple errand to deliver a message to Fort Endurance turns into anything but simple when a strange and powerful beast of darkness begins to stalk the night.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 4-12.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211688.name: Training Camp
211688.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

Premiere at Dragon Con

From the introduction:

The Gran March army is busy fighting the Giants in Geoff, and refugees continue to pour into Gran March. Now a new force is rising out of the dust, attacking travelers, towns, and even individual homes.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 4 - 10.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211689.name: Rustling in the Reeds
211689.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The military has hired you to escort a work-gang to newly uncovered ruins found in the Rushmoors. A short trip, good money, and a festival afterwards... what could go wrong?

A Gran March adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Part One in the "Whispers from the Swamp" series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211690.name: Homecoming
211690.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

“I need an immediate escort to Shiboleth,” says the white-haired man. “Some disturbing developments have endangered some family interests there, and I must address the issues quickly. I would be willing to pay you if you can get me there as soon as possible.”

A Gran March Regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Part One of the “For Commandant and Country” series.

211691.name: Tiny Epic Western: Kickstarter Deluxe Promo Pack
211691.description: This promo pack includes 4 new Boss Cards: the Lawman, the Bounty Hunter, the Apothecary, and the Entertainer. It also includes 2 additional Bullet Dice (Blue and Green) and a plastic windowed Wanted Card that lays over the Boss Cards for a more thematic immersion.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211692.name: On the Royal Road to Hookhill
211692.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You are tasked to escort an important dignitary across Gran March for an important meeting. A more tedious task could not be imagined, but at least you are out of harm’s way and can earn some coin.

This scenario counts as Gran March military time.

A Gran March Regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Part Two of the “For Commandant and Country” series.

211693.description:
Thug Life is a miniatures combat board game for 2 to 5 players and takes 40 minutes to play.

Players takes on the role of a Boss controlling a gang of Thugs who commit crimes and fight for control of the Streets. Each turn Bosses must measure the risk/reward of upgrading their gang, committing crimes and fighting with their rivals for money, power and respect. The success or failure of these decisions determine how many points of respect a Boss earns each turn. The first Boss to earn 13 respect wins the game.
211693.name: Thug Life: the Game

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211694.name: Ripe for the Picking
211694.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A military prisoner seeks atonement for past misdeeds, and what he confesses leads to a terrible secret.

Players are encouraged to play GRM3-02: Rotting on the Vine beforehand. Military [time units] may be used for this adventure.

A Gran March Regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Part Two of the "Shadow, Sun, and Sword" series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211695.name: Operation Black Knight
211695.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

One year ago, the military discovered the existence of a secret training camp in which boys and young men were being taught to hate their homeland and work for a new master. Now a threat has reached the top-most levels of the Gran March military. The safety of the realm is at stake, but the army is already spread thin. Can the [player characters] help them track down the culprits before the chain of command falls?

A sequel to Training Camp.

A Gran March Regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

User summary:

This adventure was noted as Version 1.4 - Premiere Version

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211696.name: A Lack of Focus
211696.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

An obsessed and power-hungry man seeks to awaken a scourge from a time when the Whispered One walked this land. His key is a young man who knows little of his past and is unsure of his future. Can you follow the faint trail and prevent an evil from being re-released into Oerth?

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Part One of the Occluded Whispers Series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211697.name: Pilgrimage
211697.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Introductory Scenario

From the introduction:

A man with a malevolent past has been bathed in the Blinding Light and has taken the first step on the One True Path. The next steps of his path lead him on a pilgrimage from Buxton’s Crossing to the Halls of Purity in Hookhill. The Church of Pholtus asks you to aid him walking the physical path that he might survive long enough to learn if his future holds redemption.

An introductory scenario for parties consisting of 1st-level characters only.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211698.name: The Gnome Who Cried Mole
211698.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Introductory Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The son of a wealthy gnomish family has played one too many practical jokes on the good people of Holly Hill. Now the citizens of this mountain hamlet pay very little attention to what the youngster says. When the day comes that he actually needs someone’s help he may be hard pressed to find volunteers.

This is an introductory Living Greyhawk module set in the Gran March and is intended for 1st level PCs only.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211699.name: The Militia Games
211699.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Every year during Needfest, the militia companies of Gran March come together outside Hookhill to practice their martial skills and test their battle readiness. Recently, the Militia Council has agreed to open up the Games to outside participants, though some veterans might not take kindly to outsiders in their Games. During the celebration and mock violence, observant contestants might catch wind of murder in the air. Let the Games Begin.

The Militia Games is a series of mock battles and contests of martial skill. Players are strongly encouraged to create Gran March veteran PCs who are interested in learning about the various Militia Groups (meta-organizations) available. PCs who would be unwilling to participate in mock combats are strongly discouraged. This is an introductory Living Greyhawk module set in the Gran March and is intended for 1st level PC’s only.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211700.name: A Week in the Life
211700.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It is a month before Richfest, and the Weaning is underway. Warriors about to muster out of the military mix with recruits in their last two months of basic training. The barracks talk is about graduation, reassignment, and life as a veteran. What could spoil this beautiful summer morning?

An adventure for 1st level characters that are either active duty members or veterans of the Gran March military.

211701.description:
WORLD AT WAR 85, VOLUME 2: BLOOD AND FURY

The Commander of the Soviet 3rd Shock Army swept his hand across the map in front of his regiment and battalion commanders, indicating the bridges across the Weser River: the first major obstacle to the Warsaw Pact invasion of northern West Germany.

BLOOD AND FURY is the second volume in The WORLD AT WAR 85 series of games of fast and furious platoon-level combat. Set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III, when the Warsaw Pact armies storm across the border of East Germany in a powerful attempt to seize northern West Germany, Denmark, and the whole of Free Europe.

The WORLD AT WAR 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, formation activation, random turn length, close air support and air cover are all integrated smoothly.
211701.name: World At War 85: Blood and Fury

211702.description:
WORLD AT WAR 85, VOLUME 3: THE UNTOLD BATTLES

The British General Heading up NATO’s military command continued. “We need reinforcements…now. How far off are the French?”

His Belgian aide responded quickly, the information at his fingertips. “They are on the move as we speak, heading for their border with West Germany, sir. Just like they have been practicing with the Bundeswehr in recent years. But other of their forces are refusing to cross our – excuse me, the Belgian border as yet. They appear to be biding their time.”

THE UNTOLD BATTLES is the third volume in The WORLD AT WAR 85 SERIES of games of fast and furious platoon-level combat. Set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III, the Warsaw Pact armies having already stormed across the border of East Germany attempting to finish their conquest of West Germany, and continue their offensive into The Low Countries, France, and the rest of Free Europe.

The WORLD AT WAR 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, formation activation, random turn length, close air support and air cover are all integrated smoothly.
211702.name: World At War 85: The Untold Battles

211703.description:
WORLD AT WAR 85, VOLUME 4: AMERICA BREACHED

We’re not even supposed to do things like this, the Police Captain thought.

She did not give credence to the initial phone reports a half hour ago, but now the growl of approaching Cuban armored vehicles echoed in the streets among the buildings of her town. She continued to shout to her officers last moment, desperate instructions: “Heads low! Stay behind the car doors or anything else solid. And if whatever we are hearing turns out to be way heavier than I think – if it shoots at you, don’t hesitate to RUN back to the Rally Point.”

AMERICA BREACHED is the fourth volume in The WORLD AT WAR 85 SERIES of games of fast and furious platoon-level combat. The series is set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III. With the Warsaw Pact armies deep into Western Europe, and war zones appearing around the world drawing away U.S. ground reinforcements, an unlikely yet powerful collection of allies seize the opportunity to storm across the Rio Grande in force, raiding deep into Texas, ostensibly to deny the U.S. parts of its oil resources. If they succeed in their goal, they potentially might disrupt U.S. military operations worldwide.

The WORLD AT WAR 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, formation activation, random turn length, close air support and air cover are all integrated smoothly.
211703.name: World At War 85: America Breached

211704.description:
WORLD AT WAR 85, VOLUME 5: STRIKE FORCE AFRICA

STRIKE FORCE AFRICA is the FIFTH volume in The WORLD AT WAR 85 SERIES of games of fast and furious platoon-level combat. The series is set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III. With the Warsaw Pact armies deep into Western Europe, war zones are appearing around the world drawing away scarce U.S. ground reinforcements. The Soviet Union and its Cuban allies widen the scope of the war to Angola in southwest Africa, engaging rebel and as well as South African Defense Force troops fighting there.

The WORLD AT WAR 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, formation activation, random turn length, close air support and air cover are all integrated smoothly.
211704.name: World At War 85: Strike Force Africa

211706.name: Quoin
211706.description:
Triangular domino game. Numbers are on sides of dominoes rather than the points (as in Triominoes)

Numbers on played tiles must match all adjacent tiles.

Points scored per lay are the product of "free numbers". These are the numbers on unmatched sides of both the laid tile and all adjacent tiles.

211707.name: The Lost Camp
211707.description:
From publisher blurb:

A one-page plan of an abandoned camp in a swampy wilderness. What is the 'exotic artefact'? Where have the camp members disappeared to? What is that strange piping heard on the wind at night? Do your player-characters have time to escape or set up defences before whatever took the camp members returns?

211708.name: The Tower in the Mist
211708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introductory Adventure for 13th Age and Gods and Icons

13th Age Roleplaying Game adventure with pre-generated first level characters showcasing how to use Gods and Icons. A great way to introduce new players to your game.

Players can pick a druid of the Old Gods, a fighter pledged to the Thirsty Gods, a Cleric of the Bright Gods, a pixie sorcerer, a goblin rogue, a ranger of the Old Gods, a paladin of the Thirsty Gods, or a barbarian with green gelatinous blood.

From a two-headed goblin, the PCs learn about the terrible mists and what that threatens the land. Can they solve the mystery of the Tower in the Mists, or will they become it’s next victims?

211709.name: Larius Firetongue's School of Sorcery
211709.description:
From publisher blurb:

School's in Session!

Corridors filled with robed apprentices. Their companions creatures both natural and conjured from worlds beyond worlds. Classrooms of bubbling cauldrons and summoning circles holding things and fiends most foul. Fantasy academia where tomes penned by inhuman scribes grant unending power. Where duels between mages are thought with spell, wand, and spectral blades.

Larius Firetongue's School of Sorcery is a Swords & Wizardry (and by extent other OSR) compatible sourcebook centering around magic school adventures, although any gaming group that has a love of all things magical can find plenty of usable material within its pages. Within this tome you shall find:

New playable races such as beastfolk, gnomes, and tieflings to reflect a diverse student body
Treasured Tomes, which turns books into treasure and whose contents can grant new skills and abilities to readers
14 pages worth of new spells, including a cantrip system representing minor expenditures of magical power used by dabblers and apprentices before they master true spells
A mage-focused hexcrawl environment, containing 3 full-fledged dungeons and a central academy filled with students and teachers with plots both fair and foul
Charts and tables for generating school-centric NPCs, plots, classroom events, and random encounters when wandering the halls of a magic school
3 different hex maps with varying levels of information, perfect for player handouts and secret GM reference!

211710.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Arms and Armor
211710.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Daughters of Aries and the Daughters of Odin…

A Mythic World of Chaos and War…

This file covers all the weapons and armors available in the Amazons Vs Valkyries campaign setting. Some are slightly altered from the core rules, others are borrowed from other sources, and some are brand new.

New Armors Include:

Cardiophylax
Manica
Helm and greaves combo
Lamellar (3 types)
Linothorax (2 types)
Reinforced shields
Wicker shields
Wearing weapons (as armor)




New Weapons Include:

Falx
Harpe
Kontos
Kopis
Makhaira
Pata
Plumbata
Sarissa
Scizore
Xyston




The appendix offers some new feats for characters who prefer to do battle with no armor or clothing at all. These include:

Jaybird
Naked Aggression
Naked and Fearless




Pick this supplement up today and you just might survive a battle between the two most powerful warrior cults in the world!

211711.name: Shadows in Focus: City By Shadow - Metrópole
211711.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Is Not for You

Metrópole was not built with shadowrunners in mind. Or even metahumans, for that matter. In the Awakened country of Amazonia, the great dragon Hualpa reigns, critters walk the streets under full protection of the law, and the people struggle to figure out how they’re supposed to fit into this huge mess.

And huge it is. With many kilometers of coastline, thousands of tangled streets, and millions of residents, the city is packed with power, money, and intrigue—everything shadowrunners need to do their work. Yeah, the job might come with a slightly elevated chance of becoming dragon food—if that worries you, maybe the work down South America way is not for you. But if you have enough courage and an appetite for the strange, Metrópole is a great way to fill it.

Metrópole is a guide to a fascinating section of the Sixth World, with information on the city, the powers within it, and the plots that will entangle shadowrunners. With NPCs, critter stats, and even a life module for Metrópole natives, the book has all you need to experience this massive sprawl.

211712.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is a set of minimaps for players to use to plan and execute their routes.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also spanners along some tracks which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in the spanner pack.

You can scale Blue Mountain Peak for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
211712.name: Jamaica (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

211713.description:
The Battlepuppy Express is a double-sided card which is added to the locomotive pool in the Snowdonia board game. This locomotive introduces a luck based mechanic to Snowdonia.
During the Jack Vasel 2015 charity auction, Tony Boydell offered his services to design a card for Snowdonia. This is the card which was produced. For this reason, the Battlepuppy Express is one of the rarest Snowdonia cards as only a few were printed.

The locomotive is based on the Double Fairlie engines which are used on the Ffestiniog mountain railway in North Wales. This 'double-ended' design dates back to 1869, and is characterized by the locomotives having a central cab with a firebox, boiler and smoke stack on either side.

The Battlepuppy (a small knitted dog) is a boardgaming celebrity, most often found in North West England. Battlepuppy is well-known for improving the luck of the player is he with. When a gamer takes possession of this locomotive card, he chooses which side of the card he wants to play with, and he may also borrow the Battlepuppy.
211713.name: Snowdonia: The Battlepuppy Express

211715.name: Battletech: Spotlight on Crescent Hawks
211715.description:
For every Kell Hounds or Wolf’s Dragoons, there are a hundred similar outfits that are just as talented—and just as deadly—that you have never heard of. Or worse, you have not heard enough. Sure, the glory hounds who make the evening tri-vid news are movers and shakers, and can change national borders whenever they want, but they’re not the only ones. For every Eridani Light Horse brigade, there is a mercenary crew with a storied battlefield history just as spectacular. These are the unit commands that have gone largely unnoticed in the long, bloody history of the Inner Sphere, their stories untold or nearly forgotten. Take a closer look at the battles and events that have shaped the human sphere, and you’ll find even two-bit troops like Wilson’s Hussars have made a difference.
Spotlight On: Crescent Hawks includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.

211716.name: John Company
211716.description:
Description from the publisher:

Over its 250-year history the British East India company grew to become one of the most influential commercial and political organizations in the world. Its profits catapulted the British Empire to global dominance and shaped the fate of some of the world’s great nations. But, its ascent was anything but easy. The Company was filled with diverging interests and struggled constantly at home and abroad.

John Company attempts to tell the story of the British East India Company from the inside out. Players will steer their dynasties through the company’s history, vying for position, power, and prestige. The goal of the game is simple: use the Company and the Company’s trade to secure your place in society back home. To this end you will guide your scions through their careers, exchanging favors for positions in London or plush colonial posts. Players will collectively control the Company, facing tough budgetary decisions and conflicting interests. Should a Governor conduct a campaign to expand company holdings or invest in his region’s infrastructure? Perhaps the honest tax revenues would be better diverted to expand his summer estate back home...

As the game continues, the Company may face open rebellion in India or outright failure as it grapples with increasingly bold attempts at regulation from the British government. It’s even possible that the Company’s trade monopoly will be revoked, leaving the players to form and operate their own trading firms. Each game offers a huge range of possibilities, informed chiefly by the decisions the players make. In addition, players can tailor their experience by using one of the three tournament scenarios that cover the Early, Mid, and Late company that can be played in about 90 minutes. The game also offers a full campaign game that will take players from 1720 to 1857 in an evening.

Taking its inspiration from Phil Eklund’s seminal Lords games, John Company offers Food Chain Magnate by way of Republic of Rome. And, with only sixty cards and a modest footprint, John Company is one of the most accessible SMG offerings to date.

211717.description:
After hours of efforts, the generator has finally started working and the screen is turning blue from its long-dead black. We have a couple of minutes to watch foreign news. Will it finally be good for us...?

Info from publisher

Set of 5 promo-cards given at Spiel 2016
211717.name: This War of Mine: TV Set Promo

211718.name: Classic Battletech Experimental Technical Readout: Primitives V
211718.description:
Before there was even a Star League, the technologies taken for granted in the thirty-first century went through their awkward paces in a universe newly opened to humankind. In an age when the BattleMech was nearly unknown, when the DropShip was a new concept, and when tanks and fighters dominated the battle zones, the technology of the day was primitive by modern standards…and each new design with an experiment unto itself.

Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume V samples more of the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the ’Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to “modern standards” and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

211719.name: Battletech Combat Manual: Kurita
211719.description:
To Honor the Dragon
Some soldiers fight for money, some to spread their version of liberty, still others for a sense of adventure. For the men and women of the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery there is only one reason for service: the honor of the Dragon.
From the moment Shiro Kurita raised the Dragon’s banner, the soldiers of House Kurita have remained dedicated to the warrior’s path above all others. For seven centuries they have spread fear and respect in equal measure, expanding and protecting the Dragon with loyalty and honor tempered by the ancient code of bushido and forged in battles on a hundred worlds.
BattleTech Combat Manual: Kurita contains information on these warriors. This manual examines the combat commands of the Draconis Combine, detailing their histories, tactics, unit crests, paint schemes, and notable personnel. This Alpha Strike expansion includes special rules for unique character abilities, faction-specific rules, force-building, and a mini-Technical Readout—everything you need to field your favorite Draconis Combine unit on the tabletop, or create your own.

211720.name: Battletech Combat Manual: Mercenaries
211720.description:
Some soldiers fight for king and country, some for honor and glory, others for liberty or loved ones. We’ll fight for that too, whatever your cause, as long as the check clears.
For over forty centuries, mercenaries have plied their trade and been instrumental in toppling empires or holding the tides of war at bay. And as mankind expanded to the stars, soldiers of fortune rose to new heights of power. Business is booming, yet along with those riches comes a dangerous life and the scorn of many who see only filthy lucre-warriors. It’s a dangerous life, but as long as you keep your ’Mech intact and your bottom line balanced, the universe is yours!

BattleTech Combat Manual: Mercenaries contains information on the soldier-for-hire trade and their place in the Inner Sphere. This manual takes a look at some of the most renowned mercenaries of the 31st century, detailing their histories, tactics, unit crests, paint schemes, and notable personnel. This Alpha Strike expansion includes special rules for unique character abilities, faction-specific rules, force-building, and a mini Technical Readout—everything you need to field your favorite mercenary command on the tabletop or create your own.

boardgamepublisher: シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)
211724.description: This expansion includes 6 Idol cards, 6 Producer cards, 15 Event cards, 3 Initial Idol cards. Using this expansion set means you can now play Starlight Stage with 5 people.
211724.name: Starlight Stage Expansion Card Set 2

211727.name: Folanimos
211727.description:
A game of observation and speed. What cry might a lion with a cow's body make? Or a mouse with an elephant's head? A crazy game of animal cries that might make you lose your head!

In more detail: Game comes with 48 wooden tiles, 24 with animal heads, and 24 with the corresponding bodies. These tiles are put together so that heads are connected to a non matching body. Then cards that match the tiles are flipped over one at a time. The players must find the tile that matches the card and then make the noise that you would expect from the other half. E.g. If the card showed a frog's head and the frog's head tile was joined to the body of a pig, the players would need to make an 'Oink' noise. The first player to make the correct animal sound wins the card.

211728.name: Kierowcy!
211728.description:
Simple set collection and racing game for kids. Player controls one of six different cars of municipal services (police car, fire engine, school bus, taxi, garbage truck and ambulance) and travels through the city on the round board.
Each car has a possibilty to collect three items connected to it within 18 hidden on a map at the beggining of the game. Players try to find their objects - in this case they can hold them. If they find an item connected to other car, they have to show it to other players and place unrevealed on the map. Unused cars stay in a center of a map and can be used by all players who are able to change their own cars whenever they want to.
The goal is to collect as a first player set of certain items dependent on number of players (from 4 to 6).

211731.description: This promo pack for Scythe includes encounter cards 29-32, all of which are included in every Kickstarter copy of Scythe (STM601-604) but NOT in any retail copy (STM600).
211731.name: Scythe: Promo Pack #1

211732.name: Scythe: Promo Pack #3
211732.description: This promo pack for Scythe includes objective cards 24-27, all of which are included in every Kickstarter copy of Scythe (STM601-604) but NOT in any retail copy (STM600).

211733.description: This promo pack for Scythe includes factory cards 13-18, all of which are included in every Kickstarter copy of Scythe (STM601-604) but NOT in any retail copy (STM600).
211733.name: Scythe: Promo Pack #4

211734.name: 老師敬服
211734.description:
User summary
老師敬服 (Rohshi Keifuku) in English would be 'Master of Respect'.

In the game of Master of Respect, players are old masters of martial arts, and their goal is to expand their dojo, their training school, by assigning actions to their students, such as inviting a new student, training a student, and mastering a skill.

Each round, players secretly assign actions to their students. Then they take turns revealing and executing an action. When a player executing an action, other players may give a respect to that player to take the same action.

At the end of the game, players score victory points from respects given, resources remaining, students invited and trained, and skills mastered.

This is a resource management game with action programming mechanism. You need to plan several turns ahead, but sometimes you need to modify your plan in response to other players' actions for better outcome.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは武術を極めた老師となり自分の道場を大きくすることが目標です。
弟子に行動をタイルで指示し、弟子を増やしたり、弟子を鍛えたり、奥義を習得したりすることで道場が大きくなります。
さらに、他人の弟子の行動を敬服することで同じ行動をすることができます。
敬服されたプレイヤーは勝利点やボーナスを得ます。
うまく他人に敬服されるように、そして他人の行動をうまく敬服しつつ、
自分の行動を考える、プロットタイプのリソースマネージメントゲームです。

211735.name: A Holy Piece of Wetwork
211735.description:
From the publishers website:

The Heart of Death

Auslander. If you haven’t heard the name, you’re lucky. If you have heard it, then you know enough to be worried. But not scared, because fear’s not part of the job. Which is good, because the job Mr. Johnson’s got in store for you is a big one—going to Auslander’s home metaplane and talking him out, once and for all.

It’s not safe. Of course it’s not. Even the act of getting to the metaplane will cost blood, and nothing gets easier from there. Every type of assault will be thrown at the runners, and they will need every milligram of their considerable skills if they want to succeed and, somehow, survive.

A Holy Piece of Wetwork is a Prime Mission, a run designed for high-level players whose abilities have grown beyond the challenge provided by regular Missions. The adventure is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition, and the plot can also be used with Shadowrun: Anarchy with adaptation of character stats and adjustment to some other mechanics.

211736.name: The Lost City of Barako
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
211736.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 6 Adventure at the Center of Aereth

The pleasure palace of Barako rises above the Bleak Shores atop enormous stone pylons. The palace arches towards the cavernous gloom, lit by a thousand lanterns fueled by the rendered flesh of a thousand lamenting souls. Within the city, hellish figures dart and whirl in the flickering light, prostrating themselves before their Aghartan masters, all to the cacophonic beat of a thousand alien instruments. What adventures will you find here?

211737.name: Shadow Conjuration
211737.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spell Power: Shadow Conjuration includes a handful of new feats for fans of the shadow conjuration, greater shadow conjuration, and shades spells, plus plot hooks to bring your adventurers in quickly using these spells and feats!

Feats include Shadow Augmentation, Shadow Collaboration, Shadow Piercing, Shadow Stealth and Shadow Wracking! The plot hooks wrapped around shadow conjuration include a clever illusionist, wealthy wizard, a powerful shadow demon, and a savvy sorcerer!

211738.name: Black Tentacles
211738.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spell Power: Black Tentacles includes a handful of new feats for fans of the black tentacles spell, plus plot hooks to bring your adventurers in quickly using this spell and feats!

Feats include Disarming Tentacles, Grasping Tentacles, Tame Tentacles, Tractable Tentacles, and Vicious Tentacles! The plot hooks wrapped around black tentacles include a cursed ring of freedom, a gauntlet of deadly traps, a villainous conjurer, and a mysterious merchant!

211739.name: Feats of Valor
211739.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Valor includes twelve new feats for chivalrous cavaliers, pious paladins, intrepid inquisitors, monastic monks, and other valorous warriors: Armored Mount, Blade Style, Blessed Blade, Celestial Aura, Celestial Channeling, Combat Tactician, Holy Slayer, Intrepid Mercy, Liberal Tactician, Stunning Discipline, Temple Blade, and Valorous Resolve.

211740.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 6, Issue 15 - New Psychic Power)
211740.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This Week we have some new psychic powers and flavors and flaws.

211741.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 6, Issue 16 - Phasing)
211741.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: Take the phasing power into a whole new direction.

211742.name: Avalon Haunts 06
211742.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need something a bit scary for your game? Here’s Avalon Haunts! Each issue brings you a unique, fun, and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop the them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt! You will find them easy to use, fun to play, and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have another haunting tale to scare and thrill your players with.

211743.name: Five Druids
211743.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a great NPC to give your game some thrills and fun, well Avalon is here with an other great pathfinder based product. Yep Avalon is happy to offer you five great NPCs. Each issue will come with a selection of five characters that you can introduce to your game. Need a villain, well we got them. Need a love interest or rival. Yep, they are there.

Join the fun and have a seat at the round table of fun with Avalon Games.

211744.name: Never Comin' Back
211744.description:
From publisher blurb:

The merc team are transporting a large stash of a variety of military goods to a remote outpost in the middle of a warzone. Some of those goods aren't quite kosher, as well. But it's all in a day's work for a mercenary company. To carry all those goods at once, the mercs have stripped their copter of a lot of their usual equipment. But they're well behind the battle lines, so it's not really a worry. Only, a hired hit squad has been dogging the mercs from a distance for a while now, waiting for a good chance to strike. Which just got handed to them on a silver platter...

211746.name: Mythic Gods & Monsters
211746.description:
From publisher blurb:

A guidebook for game masters on how to create mythic gods and mythic monsters that meddle in the lives of the player characters.

This book makes filling out a pantheon with unique and interesting gods fast and easy.

It then arms GMs with the tool to make mythic monsters to challenge PCs with.

Why Mythic Gods?

The main reason we created this book was all the stories we've read over the years where gods leave indelible marks on the story, the heroes, and the world. Dark cults serving nameless horrors must be stopped by brave heroes. Epic quests spawned by divine machinations put heroes into strange lands battling bizarre monsters. Godly ambition drives characters into places not meant for mortals.

But the problem is gods are given short shrift at the game table. Clerics and other player characters draw powers from these beings and wield it in their names, yet what thanks do the gods get for this? Those players who bother to write the name of a deity on their character sheet soon forget about it along with the 10 foot pole in their backpack. Neglected and ignored, gods underperform for your campaign, making your job as GM tougher.

The gods should be active plot agents for you! They should inspire factions and villains to threaten the PCs. They should provide you (un)holy places and dungeons for the party explore. And gods should give you a wonderful platform to drive stories from, and inspire and enhance your plots with.

However, we feel this is should not be done with simplistic confrontations with gods where they beat the PCs over the head with quests and plot hooks. Nothing breaks immersion more than NPCs with obvious golden exclamation marks over their heads. Instead, aim for subtle. Render the gods' influence through mortal religions, followers seeking divine favour, and monsters transformed by immortal threads.

This book will show you how to do this. We give you a system that starts at the top - god creation - and guides you through the layers of pantheon creation, religion creation, and divine-touched monster design so you have everything you need to meddle in the character's lives with the subtlety of Shakespeare. No longer will your gods be taken for granted and be just spell sieves for spoiled PCs. It's time for your gods to take part in your milieu and be active agents within it, to make your job of plotting and creating cool foes and encounters much easier. It's time to wield the Mythic God Generator!

Become a Divine Game Master

This book arms you for your GMing life. Whether you need a god for a random encounter, a pantheon on the fly, or an in-depth religion for your world, I believe Mythic Gods & Monsters has everything you need to be a Divine Game Master.

211747.name: Jumbalup
211747.description:
Jumbalup plays with words, syllables and sounds, and combines observation, memory and strategy with a bit of luck.

Make strange and fantastic creatures in a race to complete your animals first. The winner is the first player to collect four real animals with matching heads and tails.

Players take turns to draw a card adding a head or tail to their collection or saving a special card to play later - using a Jumbalup card to steal a head or a tail from another player or playing a dodo to slow another player down.

The cards can also be used to play a matching pairs memory game (with twists) for younger players (3+).

A pack of Jumbalup contains 56 standard sized playing cards and a printed rule sheet.

211749.name: Apes Victorious
211749.description:
Publisher Blurb

Apes Victorious is a roleplaying game in which you take the role of an astronaut from the 1970’s who finds himself marooned on a future Earth ruled by intelligent apes. Players may also take the role of an ape, a degenerated human, or a psi-active underdweller. Fight to survive in this post-apocalyptic future ruled by four species of apes. Or play apes who hunt humans for sport. For a different kind of campaign, play highly intelligent but insane underdwellers who have advanced technology and powerful psi powers.

This book contains:


A complete game
A post-nuclear apocalyptic setting in which apes have become the dominant species
Seven player classes
Animals and creatures of the post-nuclear future
Campaign advice
A complete introductory adventure
Conversion notes for compatible games including: Labyrinth Lord, Mutant Future, Starships & Spacemen

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211750.name: The Whispered Path
211750.description:
A Three-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

A chance encounter while waiting to join a caravan leads to adventure in southern Gran March. Will your relatively inexperienced adventurers be up to the challenges of the Rushmoors?

A Gran March introductory adventure for 1st level characters.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211751.name: The Commandant's Parlor
211751.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Petros Gwalchen has more dire tidings for the Commandant of Gran March. Another plot against the strongest military power in the Sheldomar Valley and its duly appointed leader is about to manifest, and, once again, the Commandant appears to be uninterested or unaware of unfolding events. Politics and surveillance prevent Petros from delivering the message himself, but you are another matter.

A Gran March regional adventure for [characters level] 6 - 12, and Part One of The Outsiders In series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211752.name: Enemy of my Enemy
211752.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Three young soldiers have been murdered at the edge of the Dim Forest and neither their commander nor the law seems to care. An Uncle asks for justice at best, and to just know why at worst.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211753.name: Pruning at the Root
211753.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The recent assassination attempt on the Commandant was indeed the last straw in Gran March. The Commandant has called on all available resources in order to find them. Yet, there is another (and less forgiving) group that wants to see the end to this band as well. Parties should be formed into lawful and non-lawful groups.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 4 - 18, and Part Four of Shadow, Sun, and Sword series.

211754.name: Grand Pigeon's Duty
211754.description:
User Summary

You are a pigeon, charged to make people realize you need more food for pigeons to survive. This silly premise -- and other jokes -- means that the action is to defecate on people as you fly over them.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211755.name: The Lines are Blurred
211755.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Released from his binding prison, an ancient wraith sweeps across the March leaving death and undeath in his wake. Is all this chaos and destruction part of some nefarious plan?

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12 and Part Two of the Occluded Whispers series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211756.name: Familiar Territory
211756.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

What began as a simple escort mission to Fort Tribulation becomes an important diplomatic mission in the Rush March.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Note: This adventure counts as Gran March Military and Caravan Duty.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211757.name: Family Fortunes
211757.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Watcher Reginar Vlarrian, Elder Oath-Bound Gargoyle has received disturbing news that one of his fallen brothers’ souls is not at rest. He has entreated like-minded servants of righteousness to investigate and see the matter put right. At the same time a call for aid from adventurers has been issued by a minor noble from Barony Dragus. His manor has suddenly become haunted, and his new bride is threatening to abandon him and the family home.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12, and Part One of the War of the Undying series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211758.name: Justice Be Done
211758.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Each year, young men and women from across Gran March mark their 15th birthdays and await the arrival of Mustering Day with a mixture of anticipation and dread. Everyone, from the poorest commoner to the richest nobleman, understands the necessity of serving Commandant and Country. The idea that an entire village would refuse to send its children to the Army is simply unthinkable. And yet, that is exactly the situation that you are being asked to investigate.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 8, and Part One of the War of the Undying series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211759.name: Up a Winding Stair
211759.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Rumor of several epidemics spreading through northeastern Gran March have reached the ears of the Hospitalers and temples in Hookhill. A call has gone out in Hookhill for healers and adventurers of all kind to attend a convocation to investigate the strange plagues and put a stop to them.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12, and Part Three of the Outsiders In series.

Note: This adventure counts towards Military Duty and Caravan Duty.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211760.name: All That is Secret and Hidden
211760.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Earthquakes, massive sinkholes and an invasion by giant forces in the last year have left Shiboleth bloodied and nearly broken. Volunteers have come to clear away wreckage and death while an army rides to help. But not everyone is in Shiboleth to help. Some who have been there for millennia are visiting for the first time. Some secrets, once released, were never contained.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12, and Part 2 of the Shattered Reflection series.

Military Time: Yes Caravan: Yes

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to Gran March military PCs, members of the Church of Pholtus and members of the Corporation.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211761.name: Family Values
211761.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Nackel gnomes have gone missing in Shiboleth and their sister and mother want your help in finding them, but can anyone find anything in the rubble of Shiboleth? Apparently someone can, as the gnomes’ trail leads to a newly erected gladiatorial arena, an infiltration of Baklunish spies, and the mystery of who murdered their father four years ago.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12, and Part 2 of the War of the Undying series.

Military Time: No; Caravan Duty: Yes

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of The Corporation, Followers of Kord and those holding the Promise to the Nackel Gnomes from GRM5-06: Family Fortunes.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211762.name: Crystal Clear
211762.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It is now obvious that the Vecna-worshiping undead from the Lortmils are not focused on the Dim Forest. A showdown is coming, with Gran March's greatest hope coming from an unlikely ally, and you will be key to stopping this threat once and for all time.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] six to twelve, and Part Three of the "Occluded Whispers" Series.

It is strongly recommended that participating PCs have played at least one of the two previous adventures in this series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to Gran March Army PCs and Members of the Shadowhunters.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211763.name: Curtains Drawn Around
211763.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Watcher Corum Valstier has been kidnapped by some unknown enemy of Gran March masquerading as a fellow knight. The fiend has brazenly called out the Knights of the Watch, the Church of Heironeous, and heroes of Gran March at large challenging them to catch him if they can. Following the creature's trail should be no problem as it begins a cross country trek from Orlane to points east leaving a trail of chaos in its wake. Catching it and rescuing Valstier, however, may prove more challenging.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12, and Part Four of the "Outsiders In" Series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211764.name: The Trouble With Weeds
211764.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

They say that vineyard in Orlane is haunted, but the Gran March army says it isn’t so. Adventurers wanting to test their mettle are now flocking back to Orlane to kill undead. Will your group of adventurers find out the truth?

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12, and the epilogue of the Shadow, Sun, and Sword series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to wizards and druids.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211765.name: Athenaeum
211765.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Danger lurks in the august halls of Gran March’s grand library. Your future tells of tomes, knowledge and transformation. How high must you climb to find an enemy so familiar it might have once been one of your own? Others were here first, and might seek to reclaim knowledge once promised and never delivered.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 16, and Part 3 of the Shattered Reflections series.

Military Time: Yes. Caravan: Yes.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of Syrloch, the Knights of the Watch, Gran March military PCs, and PCs with knowledge of Gran March. Despite The Athenaeum’s significance to Syrloch PCs, well-balanced parties are still strongly recommended.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211766.name: Coming Home
211766.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

All Lortenford celebrates the return of a favorite son. Captain Trellheim Ennister has come home and brings along his bride-to-be, but do the pealing bells perhaps signal something more foul afoot? Sometimes coming home is more difficult than one foresees.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Military Time: Yes. Caravan: Yes.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of the Gran March military.

211767.name: Broke, Dead & F*cked
211767.description: A card game for mature audiences. Players take turns playing cards on themselves or an opponent to affect their scores in Money, Health and Dilation points. The first player who is broke, dead and f*cked wins the game.

211768.name: God Game:  The Odyssey
211768.description:
User Summary

You control the winds to send ships to their destination. The plot resembles Odysseus' return from Troy.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211769.name: Exigency
211769.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Sometimes things are best not disturbed. Some things are best left asleep. Some people’s thirst for knowledge or loot knows no bounds. These three facts make an unsettling combination that falls to others to resolve.

A Gran March regional introductory adventure for 1st level characters only

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211770.name: Inauspicious
211770.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

"Meet me at the Distant Star in Ghostgate" the Ridefinder’s message said, "your assistance is needed in a matter of importance." A room in this high class inn and an initial retainer were excellent starts to any adventure.

A Gran March Introductory adventure for military and non-military characters alike.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211771.name: By Right of Conquest
211771.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Interactive

From the introduction:

For millennia, land in the Sheldomar Valley has been claimed by those with the strength to take it and to hold it. Invaders laying unlawful claims are not to be tolerated and allies should come together to retake lands wrongly seized. The time has come to reclaim Shiboleth.

A Gran March Regional battle-intensive interactive for [character levels] 2 - 14, and Part 5 of the Shattered Reflections series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of the Knights of the Watch, the Gran March Army and Syrloch.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211772.name: Hammerfall
211772.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Knight Colonel Jabbar began, All warfare is based on deception. Hence, when able to attack, we must seem unable; when using our forces, we must seem inactive; when we are near, we must make the enemy believe we are far away; when far away, we must make him believe we are near. We will use the river to swiftly move forces with stealth under cover of night to a place that they are not expected. Those who defend the Hammer see the river as protecting their flank; we will use it as an avenue of attack. An amphibious landing, then swarm the walls before the defender can rally.

A Gran March Interactive adventure for [character levels] 2 - 8. Characters not well suited to amphibious and siege operations should request transfer to other units. This adventure should be played after GRM7-IN5: Hammerstrike.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to Active Duty Military and Veteran Characters.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211773.name: Troubled Waters
211773.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Gran March River Guard has decided to show off a bit of its strength in a competitive regatta. Nobles from around the realm will be attending and participating. They require both assistance and bodyguards. The trip sounds like a nice bit of vacation; after all, how eventful can sailing be?

A dangerous two-round Gran March Regional Interactive for [character levels] 2 - 14, and Part 6 of the Homefront series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to PCs who have previously adventured in Ghostgate, members of the River Guard and Gran March Military Personnel plus those who have played other games in the Homefront Series.

rpgseries: GRM - Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventures
211775.name: Gnome Friends
211775.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A young gnome was brought into Ander’s Falls near death by a kindly merchant. The local clerics were able to heal him, and he revealed that his village had been ransacked by Mountaineers. A Captain of the Sixth is sending you to determine what really happened to their gnome friends.

A Gran March regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12, and Part 1 of the Homefront series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to Mountaineers, other members of the Gran March military, and members of the Gnome Meta-Org.

211776.name: The Pastry Lady
211776.description:
Barovian Bedtime Stories

From the introduction:

Small, scared and trapped in a dark basement. Take on the part of small children who must gather their wits and their courage to escape the clutching grasp of The Pastry Lady and her impish little helper Little Lenny. Will you find the light of day and your freedom, exposing their dark deeds? Or will you discover a fate far worse than anyone could possibly imagine.

An introductory adventure for 3 - 5 new players

211777.name: Fine China
211777.description:
User Summary

Fine China is a VR 'you-break-it-you-buy-it' simulator for the HTC Vive.

211778.name: 12 Orbits
211778.description:
12 orbits is the only local multiplayer game for 2-12 people at once.

Source: The Game Website.

211779.name: Pathfinder Map Pack: Bridges
211779.description:
Publisher's Website:

None Shall Pass!

What lurks beneath the bridge? Whether heroes are fleeing an angry mob, escaping a magical creature that can't cross running water, or leaving town on a grand quest, bridges help them reach further adventures. Game Masters shouldn't have to draw every riverside ambush site or paving stone. This Pathfinder Map Pack provides beautifully illustrated 5" × 8" map tiles that can be combined into a variety of bridges and river crossings. Inside, you'll find 18 richly crafted map tiles, including:

Fortified Stone Bridge
Middle Stretch
Old Crossing
Rickety Wooden Span
Rocky Arch
Rotted Boards




Game Masters shouldn't waste their time sketching maps whenever characters approach a stream. With Pathfinder Map Pack: Bridges, you'll always be ready when your players decide to burn that bridge when they come to it!

211780.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Mythos Dungeon
211780.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Stygian Depths

Whether your players are struggling to maintain their sanity in a mind-warping vault filled with elder evils or simply looking for a good place to curl up and drool, Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Mythos Dungeon has you covered. Each side of the Flip-Mat features the ruins of a madness-inspired dungeon home to alien entities best left undisturbed. Don't waste your time sketching when you could be playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Mythos Dungeon, you'll be prepared next time your players want to risk their minds and souls as they venture out in search of the unknown!

Get to the game faster with Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Mythos Dungeon, and be ready whenever your players stumble across horrors from beyond space and time!

211781.name: Vacation Isle: Beach Party
211781.description:
User Summary
A collection of 8 mini games including wakeboarding, surfing and fire dancing.

211782.name: Kim Possible 4: Kimmunicator
211782.description:
User Summary
An action platfomer featuring Disney's heroine.

211783.name: Kim Possible 6: Global Gemini
211783.description:
User Summary
An action platfomer featuring Disney's heroine.

211785.name: Springo
211785.description:
Springo is a classic roll-and-move game in which players race with their pawns to the middle of the board.

Each player controls 4 pawns. At the beginning of the game each pawn is on the outer ring. The goal of the game is to move the pawns to the inner rings and finally to the middle. Every turn a player throw a dice and choose which pawn to move clockwise around the circle that the pawns is currently. If the pawn ens its move in the same place as the other pawn, the other one goes back to the starting place. If a pawn finishes a move in a horse spot, then the next move that pawn will do is going to the inner circle. If it is the most inner circle then that pawn finishes his game in one of the six spots in the middle of the board.
