3 players 12 cards alt least
4 players 10 cards alt least
5 players 8 cards alt least

Components: A deck of 105 especial cards. 10 chips of isolation tape. The cards represent 3 types of cable or wire and shortcircuits.

211910.name: Scary Humans
211910.description:
Run away from humans and find your way out of the MIC. Pick up keys, open doors, eliminate humans, knock them out by shouting… enjoy the terror and tension of being chased through 6 levels procedurally generated. Terror, aliens and a vintage touch… Scary Humans has it all!

Source: The Game Website.

211911.name: Kyurinaga's Revenge
211911.description:
3D platforming with high doses of action. Lots of challenging puzzles and frenetic combat. New characters and enemies. Play solo or with a friend in a local co-op mode. A 2D cartoonish and engaging living world, set in the Feudal Japan. Samurais, ninjas, ronins and more!

Source: The Developer Website.

211912.name: Arung Ry Outpost: Cantina
211912.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arung Ry Outpost is home to smugglers, bandits, exiles, and other similar types that need to stay away from populated planetary systems, either by choice or to avoid the authorities. The Cantina in Arung Ry is a popular location, with a bar, live music, food and private rooms.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting a futuristic tavern or bar on a dry and dusty planet. The large taproom has booths for privacy, a stage for live music, dining tables and a large bar. Private rooms and a back room/office for the owner complete the building. Ideal for W40K, Firefly and Star Wars games.

211913.description:
A simple roll and move game of collecting a set of four tokens from the board. The key is in the cards: in order to collect a token, you must read a card and act what the card says.

The cards are about emotions and feelings, recognising and expressing them. The game is educational and aimed to teach the kids to express their feelings.

This is a slightly simplified and a much smaller version of Ihmevekotin (2009). The board is the same, but with less cardboard decorations and in smaller size. The tokens are slightly different. The cards are very similar.
211913.name: Seikkailujen saari

211914.name: Open the Bridge
211914.description: The fun game in which players open and close the bridges to win the race with their car and boat.

211915.name: Aflakló
211915.description:
User summary:

In Aflakló the goal is to be the wealthiest player when the market cards deck is depleted. Players roll a die to move around Iceland and depending on the spaces they land on they can buy fish plants, go fishing, draw event cards or sell their catch. Event cards are played immediately, but players also have action cards which can be used when needed, usually to wreck havoc amongst the other players. When players buy fish plants (or land on existing ones) they can go fishing, and then sell their catch later. The price depends on the market cards in the center of the board which are changed when players cross the starting space.

Description from the publisher:
Aflakló is a revolutionary new Icelandic board game where players compete to expand their fisheries empires by sailing around Iceland, catching and selling fish and taunting each other. On every corner danger is near, in the form of changing government, Norwegian fishermen and Greenpeace. Players have to have steel nerves to withstand the pressures and have a chance to win.

211916.name: The Restoration of Ilkannon
211916.description:
The ruins of Ilkannon have been discovered! After being lost for centuries, you now have a chance at learning about the heart of that mythic civilization! Choose your character and begin your adventure into the wilds! But watch out! The curse which brought Ilkannon to ruin is still housed within its walls! Restore the city - but make sure you don’t unleash corruption upon the world!

You play one of four characters: An adventurer, a politician, a scholar, or a mechanic. Each person has their own goals within the city, and each one has their own faults that make them susceptible to various curses. The ultimate end goal is to find four power crystals to revitalize the city or to find one item to bring back to tell of their great discovery!

There are four main stats which each character has: Corruption Resistance, Movement, Restoration, and Ingenuity. Corruption Resistance is how susceptible a character is to the dark forces still at work in Ilkannon. This is used mostly during events. Movement is how far the character can move on their turn. Restoration is how many tiles a character can restore on their turn. Ingenuity is used for events, and is based on how well the character deals with certain situations outside of their normal state. Corruption Resistance and Ingenuity affect how many dice the character rolls during certain events.

The city of Ilkannon is composed of sixteen tiles, laid out in a grid of four by four. These tiles are double sided, with one side being Wilderness and the other side being the Restored city.

Turn order is as follows:

1) Move or Restore
2) Draw an Event
3) Corruption activates. This only happens once part of Ilkannon is Restored. If no tiles are Restored, Corruption sleeps.

211917.name: Mark McMorris: Infinite Air
211917.description:
Join pro snowboarder Mark McMorris and an elite crew of riders in a vast, open-world snowboarding experience. Compete in authentic events, drop in on any mountain peak by helicopter, and design your own snow parks to shred with the World Editor.

Source: The Game Website.

211918.name: The Beard in the Mirror
211918.description:
A point-and-click adventure filled with magic, danger, fantasy, and romance.

Source: The Developer Website.

211919.name: The Shape Of Heart
211919.description:
Have you ever tried to save your lunch money in order to buy a game or comic book? After so many years, you have grown up, but your colorful life costs all your energies. The unlimited pressure makes you exhausted. Is there anything that could fulfill the void of your heart?

Source: The Developer Website.

211920.name: Marlene
211920.description:
User Summary

Ewan has been unable to contact his estranged sister and niece at their island cottage so sets out to find out what has happened to them.

211921.name: Mythic Wars: Cthulhu Rises
211921.description: Mythic Wars: Cthulhu Rises, the first expansion set for Mythic Wars, adds 16 new cards (8 gods and goddesses, and 8 creatures) based on the writings of H.P. Lovecraft. When combined with the Clash of the Gods base set, 4-8 players can join together and try to defeat the invading Outer Gods, including Azathoth, Nyarlathotep, Cthulhu, and many others.

211922.name: Golden Krone Hotel
211922.description:
Golden Krone Hotel is a gothic horror roguelike. Fight vampires with sunlight or become a vampire yourself and sneak in the shadows. Combines classic turn-based combat with dynamic lighting, an innovative potion system, and fast paced gameplay.

Source: The Game Website.

211923.name: Celestial FireStorm
211923.description:
Description from the designer:

Players choose one of the five celestial animals to fight for supremacy of the skies - using fireworks! Connect firework tiles to gain territory, break up other firework collections, and battle for the largest section of the night sky.

The game is played with tiles, each tile is broken into four sections and contains four fireworks. At the start of the game, players are dealt three tiles. Then they choose the celestial animal they want to play - there can only be one player for each animal. Players place their tiles in such a way as to connect the most fireworks for their animal together. Tiles can be placed over other tiles, as long as the tile below isn't locked.

Each turn players:

Play one tile from their hand.
Draw a new tile from the pool of tiles.




Play continues until all the tiles have been placed. At the end of the game, all the fireworks on the board are tallied for points.

The game includes rules for solitaire play.

211924.name: Snow-White and Rose-Red
211924.description:
Description from the designer:

Snow-White and Rose-Red is a fairy tale adventure where you take control of Snow-White and/or her sister Rose-Red. The goal is to save the Enchanted Bear, who once was a prince but has fallen under a vile curse from the Ungrateful Dwarf.

To defeat the Ungrateful Dwarf you need to steal back the treasure he stole from the prince or you need to remove his source of power - his luxuriant beard - with a pair of scissors. Explore the woods near Mother's Cottage, rescue trapped animals, and make sure you never have more than four curses upon you at a time! Will you be able to save the Enchanted Bear and defeat the Ungrateful Dwarf? Or will you become cursed too?

Each turn the sisters travel to different locations around the board to have encounters. These encounters can lead to rescuing animal companions, gaining useful items, collection treasure, encountering the Ungrateful Dwarf, or encountering the Enchanted Bear. Watch out for the curses! Curses make it harder for the sisters to complete their goals! The encounters at the locations are different depending on which sisters are present, and if both sisters are there.

This game can be played solo where one person controls one or two of the sisters, or can be played as a full co-op where both sisters quest to save the Enchanted Bear.

211925.name: Pounce and Stalk
211925.description:
Description from the designer:

This morning your mother, a superb snow leopard, took you outside to practice your pouncing. What she didn't realize is that a deadly Siberian tiger stalks these mountains too! Find the adult snow leopard before you find the Siberian tiger to win in this game of frolics turned fatal!

In this game, one or two players play a group of four snow leopard cubs who are in danger! They must find their mother before the Siberian Tiger finds them. The board is made up of thirty cards, played face down. Twenty-eight of those cards are mountains, one is the adult snow leopard, one is the Siberian tiger.

On each player's turn, as long as they hold a snow leopard cub in their hand, they may swap that card with any card on the board. The card they take is revealed. If it is a mountain, nothing happens. If it is the Siberian tiger, all is lost. If it is the adult snow leopard, they win!

If the adult snow leopard or Siberian tiger hasn't yet been found, for each snow leopard cub already on the board, the player can flip face-up one card that is located diagonally adjacent to the snow leopard cub card. These cards are flipped down at the end of the turn.

Once all the snow leopard cub cards have been played, players may retrieve a snow leopard cub card on their next turn by swapping it back out with a Mountain card in your hand. When playing a two-player game, this means you can start to retrieve your cards after playing two, instead of all four.

This game can be played solo, with one person controlling all four snow leopard cubs, or fully co-op with two players playing two cubs each.

211926.name: Bears vs Babies: NSFW Booster Pack
211926.description: Bears vs Babies: NSFW Booster Pack includes non-kid friendly cards for use in the Bears vs Babies base game.

211927.name: Autumn Slipstream
211927.description:
Publisher summary
Rich in resources, simmered in debauchery, and apprehensive of a reclusive AI society, the Autumn Slipstream offers an intriguing setting for space-faring sci fi games.

The original text was compiled from contest submissions by several RPGG members. Stats are listed assuming diaspora or another Fate-based game, but can be quickly translated to other systems.

211928.name: Power Pack
211928.description:
User Summary: Power Pack was a game compilation for Atari ST containing 20 games.

In Germany the game Predator was exchange to Winter Olympiad 88 for licencing issues.

211929.name: Ace
211929.description:
User Summary

Ace is version of the classic game Snake, by Matthias Kramm in 1992.

211930.name: The Astronauts
211930.description:
User Summary

The Astronauts is a game for the Commodore 64 where the player playes a astronat going from the base to the launching ramp and then into space. In space the astronaut meet attacking rockets. The game was programmed by Andreas Mettler.

211931.name: Ballmania
211931.description:
User Summary

Ballmania is a action game. The player is controlling a ball in the lower part of the screen, trying to avoid getting hit by other balls dropping in different speed from the top of the screen and downward. To make a level the player need to survive in 90 second. The game was coded by Oliver Malms.

211932.name: Noirlandia
211932.description:
From the MakeBigThings website

Noirlandia is a cooperative roleplaying game for 3-4 players about a desperate investigation in a fantastic city. It uses Questlandia’s core world-building and narrative resolution system with a few new twists.

We’ll figure out the way our city ticks and what its secrets are—maybe it’s constantly blanketed in white ash, maybe it’s built atop the back of an enormous dying beetle, maybe only a few of us “non-synthetics” remain.

Our story follows a group of interconnected characters, a mind-bending case, and the cold stiff that started it all. Find the truth, or lose your mind trying. It’s just another day in Noirlandia.

211933.name: Green Game: TimeSwapper
211933.description:
User Summary

You control a switch that transforms time (and manipulates objects) to guide a skeleton bird through an array of obstacles to an exit.

211934.name: Player's Handbook Errata
211934.description:
From the document:

This document corrects or clarifies certain rules in Player's Handbook (D&D 5e). Recent printings of the book include revised text that reflects the explanations here.


User summary:

These errata are formally published by Wizards of the Coast as official updates and changes to the rules contained in Player's Handbook (D&D 5e). Generally, the printing of the Player's Handbook subsequent to the errata will include the changes provided in the errata. These incorporated changes are cumulative.

211935.name: Damned Cold
211935.description:
Damned Cold is a twin-stick shooter where you play as a prisoner of war trying to escape their captors through killing cold in a reactive diesel-punk world.

Source: The Developer Website.

211936.name: LUXIS
211936.description:
LUXIS is a game of memory, reflexes, intuition, and problem solving. Get lost in the atmospheric music and glowing world, then find your way out.

Source: The Developer Website.

211937.name: Book Series: Alice in Wonderland
211937.description:
https://www.facebook.com/kurisunopatto/

How far can curiosity and dreams take us? Which wonderful situations can we discover once we get carried away by the adventure? Even though it has been 150 years since its publication, the acclaimed novel by Lewis Carroll still remains as one of the greatest artistic works in the world.

211938.name: Face of Fear: A Holiday Ritual
rpg: Face of Fear: A Holiday Ritual
211938.description:
User summary:

Face of Fear: A Holiday Ritual is a rules-light, free-form roleplaying game based around the traditional action of carving a jack-o-lantern. In the game, players take turns designing and carving the jack-o-lantern in a collaborative, structured effort. Per the rules, the game is to be played only on October 31st, after 6:00 PM.

User summary:

The rules document includes minor print-and-play materials.

rpg: The Old Man and the Sea Monster
211939.name: The Old Man and the Sea Monster
211939.description:
User summary:

In this solitaire role-playing game, the player assumes the role of an old fisherman, down on his luck, who heads far out to sea to try to catch a big fish and return with bragging rights. Instead, something else happens...

211940.description: In the cooperative card game Okey Dokey, the players work as a team to put on a music festival including several different performers. You need to be able to place all fifty of the cards in the game within ten columns, but players' hands are kept secret from one another and only slight suggestions can be made.
211940.name: Okey Dokey

211941.name: The Valley of Kesh
211941.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the Anauroch desert, darkness is growing. The followers of the Vile Spore Goddess Zuggtmoy have stolen the dreams of the Bedine Seeress Deja, trapping them in an eldritch artifact. Unless her dreams are returned, the Seeress will descend into madness, and her people along with her.

211942.description:
Lock ’n Load Tactical Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era

The Lock ’n Load Tactical Compendium Volume 2 collates, in a re-edited and updated format, all of the essential Modern-Era LnLT articles, maps and scenarios from every issue of Line of Fire magazine, plus some new content.

In the Compendium Volume 2 you can read indispensable articles on forces and tactics and how to deploy them in games such as Heroes of the Nam, Heroes of the Falklands, Heroes Against the Red Star and Day of Heroes. Get up to speed on modern tank tactics. Read about the Long Range Reconnaissance Patrols (LRRPs) in Vietnam and then play two scenarios that feature them. Plus, historical articles that feature tactical insights on both Heroes of the Nam and The Bear & The Jackal provide insight and perspective into mastering the scenarios in those games—and, more importantly, in how best to defeat your opponent. And much more.

Scenarios, and more gameplay, are what most gamers want, and there are over 20 in Volume 2 of the Compendium. From a bold rescue mission in the jungle of Vietnam in 1972 to the Falkland Islands in 1982 and the Cold War gone Hot in 1985, there are battles to be fought, and desperate struggles to unfold. With over 100 pages, over 20 scenarios and 1 map, this Compendium has something for everyone who’s a fan of the Lock ’n Load Tactical series’ Modern-Era games. And it’s all right here: One game system, one era. one place!
boardgameversion: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era
211942.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era

211943.name: Sweets!
211943.description:
In Sweets!, players each start the game with three sweets cards from the fifty-card deck, with five cards placed face up in the tableau. On a turn, a player either draws a face-up card or the top card of the deck (unless they already have five cards in hand), swap two or more cards with an equal number of cards from the tableau, or eat a set of sweets in their hand to score points.

Once the deck is exhausted, each player eats once, then they tally their points based on the number of stars on the cards they ate. Whoever has the most points wins.

211945.name: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King – Adjacency Scrolls
211945.description: This small expansion consists of six tiles to be added to the tile mix. Each of the tiles contain a scroll that scores features only on adjacent tiles. Theses special scrolls are marked with arrows.

211946.description:
Tower Defense is a light, asymmetric game where one player defends a castle from the onslaught of soldiers from the other player. The defender needs to stop the hoards of soldiers while the attacker tries to destroy the castle as quickly as possible.

The game comes with a one game card which represents the playing surface. Players are expected to supply their own coins (10 one-cent coins, 10 two-cent coins, and 10 5 cent coins).

Depending on their placement, the coins have multiple purpose. They either: (1) represent the life points of the castle and the soldiers, (2) determine how a soldier enters the board when rolled by the attacker or (3) show how much damage a soldier will suffer when played by the castle defender.
211946.name: Tower Defense

211947.description:
Metal coins for Scythe (values 1,3,5,10,20).

Replaces the cardboard coins that come in in the retail edition of Scythe.
211947.name: Scythe: Metal Coins

211948.name: Robogem-lisäkortit
211948.description:
An expansion to Robogem board game. Contains 24 new cards, 8 new tiles and new rules.

- Repeat statements allow commands to be repeated infinitely or five or three times.
- Conditional statements allow for finer control: conditionals can check if it's possible to move forward, left or right, or if there's a diamond in front of the robot.
- Special cards allow robots to hijack diamonds, turn towards the closest diamond, jump over obstacles or destroy obstacles.
- Equipment cards include a rocket motor, super powers, extra card powers and the possibility to hijack someone else's robot for a turn.

New tiles include hologram plates that are safe spots for robots.

The new cards allow for more complicated programming.

211949.name: Ecolis: Save the Forest
211949.description:
User Summary
Uses small rodents to save the forest and prevent pollution. This game was funded by the World Wide Fund for Nature.

211950.name: Cabals: Card Blitz
211950.description:
BUILD YOUR DECK. GATHER YOUR HEROES. SAVE THE WORLD.

Cabals: Card Blitz is a fast-paced deckbuilding collectible card game featuring a rewarding solo adventure mode and instant multiplayer action.
Enter the portal to discover a unique realm of occult magic, interwar technology and sinister villains. Your only hope of victory lies in building brilliant decks, recruiting mighty allies, and gathering enough power to defeat the forces of evil.

DISCOVER POWERFUL CARDS

Cabals: Card Blitz boasts a stunning array of gorgeous, hand painted cards with a vast range of special abilities. Call upon the military prowess of the Vril Rocketeer; wield the dark magic of the Sisters of Connacht; unleash the extradimensional powers of the Star Spawn, and many more...

Source: The Publisher Website.

211951.name: Assault Android Cactus
videogamehonor: 2016 AGD Awards Excellence In Accessibility Nominee
2016 AGD Awards Excellence In Art Nominee
2016 AGD Awards Excellence In Audio Honorable Mention
2016 AGD Awards Game of the Year Nominee
211951.description:
Assault Android Cactus is an intense twin stick shooter set in a vivid science fiction universe. The game is named after its hero, Cactus, an "Assault" class android.

Source: The Game Website.

211952.name: The Grand Mêlée (5E)
211952.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flashing swords, shining armor, and shattering lances…

…are all part of the greatest sporting event of the Middle Ages: the Tournament.

With The Grand Melee, you have all the information you need to include a medieval tournament in your 5e campaign for the World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game. This 24-page supplement details how to set a tournament up; how one should be run; and what rewards to give the victors. Also included are optional rules for conducting jousts. So download a copy today and prepare your self for the pomp and pageantry of a medieval tournament!

211953.name: Celestial Character Options
211953.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heavenly Options for your Character!

Four Horsemen Present: Celestial Character Options seeks to provide players and game-masters with mechanical options that expand the versatility of creatures touched by the upper planes… wthout restricting them to existing planetouched races. Whether you want to add the native outsider ishvara race, find new favored class options for numerous planar-themed races, add a virtue feat (representing devotion to a moral code and only lend their benefits as long as the character follows that code), or pick up a spell from the celestial sphere, this book has you covered. We also include numerous archetypes from the angelic voice (bard) and guardian angel (cleric) to the phrenic defender (psychic) and seventh sash (arcanist). Sometimes, it’s good to be Good.

211954.name: Maverick
211954.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can't Touch This!

August was born in the Meta city-state of New Avalon. Her powers rip the stamina and memories from anyone whom she touched. As she could also steal powers with this ability, few other Meta children wanted anything to do with the young girl. Eventually learning to control her powers, she became Maverick (PL 10) using her powers for the Meta Nation, striking against the humans who oppressed her kind.

During a fight, Maverick's powers changed. She gained amazing cosmic powers, but now she could no longer control her absorbsion, leaving her unable to touch anyone skin-to-skin. Maverick sought out the aid of Dean Donovan Shepherd. He agreed to help. She agreed to try to change her ways.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

211955.name: Adept Orders & Citadels
211955.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Adepts are a mysterious group. Originally following the Way as taught by the Dregordians, these people have an extreme control over their own minds and bodies. Some few, such as some members the Warrior-Adepts of the Jade flame can attack others mind to mind, or influence them subtley. Other orders focus on the balance between mind and body. The Farspeakers guild also draws its numbers from the Adepts' numbers.

In this book, you'll learn about the various orders, find out where most of the Citadels are located and finally be told about the black Orders that work as mercenaries for anyone no matter the task - even if it means working with slavers and the like. You'll also find new gear, power edges, edges, Adept disciplines and read some rumors that might need to be investigated.

211956.name: Monstrology
211956.description:
Monstrology is a fully cooperative card game, which you can also play competitively between two teams, a la 'Charades', suitable for gamers of all ages. You can play Monstrology with 2-8 people. Each round takes about 5 minutes, with a recommendation of at least 2 rounds per player. The game requires both sides of your brain to work together, as you'll have to blend your imagination and deduction skills in order to succeed.

At the core of the game are 84 illustrated imaginary monster cards, depicting some of the most beautiful, strange, unique monsters you have ever encountered. The game also includes twelve taxonomy boards that will allow you to categorize and identify these delightful, unsettling creatures.

A simplified explanation of the game:

1. One player - the "subject" of a monstrological investigation - randomly and secretly selects an imaginary monster from the deck of monster cards.

2. The subject fills out a "taxonomy board" in order to give the other players (the "investigators") a sense of his or her monster. The subject cannot communicate with the other players in any other way - no facial expressions or hand gestures!

3. The subject places his or her monster in a lineup with other imaginary monsters (i.e. more cards).

4. The investigators attempt to deduce which monster belongs to the subject. Lively discussion ensues as the investigators attempt to convince each other that "this monster looks like he'd prefer flies to gerbils", or "are you kidding? that monster would be terrible at babysitting!"

5. The more investigators who select the correct monster, the more points the team scores.

211958.name: Shades of Angels
211958.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the frontier town of Varinsoth has known relative peace for decades, its very existence was threatened over 30 years ago thanks to the machinations the demon lord, Azimuth. Nobody knows why he sought to use the seemingly endless hordes that were at his command to destroy the town but the fiend was ultimately vanquished, primarily due to the valiant efforts of the members of a religious order known as the Exemplars of Iolanthe, after which Varinsoth’s citizens found peace once more… until now!

Unfortunately for the people of the town, rumours have recently begun to spread of inhuman creatures stirring in the dead of night around the long-abandoned tower of Stormhaven, which lies to the south. Yet of more immediate concern to Varinsoth’s populace are the concentrated series of attacks that have been perpetrated against the town’s merchant caravans over the past few weeks by the so-called ‘Crimson Hand’, a vile band of marauders who have taken scores of prisoners during the course of their attacks, none of who have been seen or heard from since. The question is; what are the Crimson Hand doing with their captives? And could a far more sinister force be behind their actions?

While Varinsoth’s future looks bleak, a number of its citizens hold dark secrets that could, if uncovered, potentially help to shed some light on the recent troubles which have plagued the town, but sometimes the past is best left buried as such revelations could ultimately cause more harm than good. If only a brave band of outsiders could be found who could view Varinsoth’s troubles through impartial eyes, and make the difficult choices that are needed to aid the people of the town in their time of greatest need. If only. Shades of Angels is an adventure designed for characters of 3rd to 7th level.

Shades of Angels contains a 73-page Introduction Book and a 190-page Adventure Book, along with numerous maps and player handouts.

211959.name: Fire in the Goal
211959.description:
User Summary

Demonstrate your sportsmanship and bring doom to your opponent.

211960.name: Climbey
211960.description:
User Summary

The goal is to climb to the finish as fast as you can, avoiding obstacles and trying not to fall along the way.

211961.name: Ne no Kami: The Two Princess Knights of Kyoto
211961.description:
“Len, you are going to abandon this town... and die—today” Since her reunion with Shinonome, Len's life is thrust into an all new “reality,” and the curtain which hid the “truth” of this new world is been lifted.

Source: The Publisher Website.

211962.name: Forest of Tataraba
211962.description:
In たたらばと森 (Tatara, Field, and Forest), each player represents a Toryo clan engaged in the production of tatara steel with the long-term goal of allowing for perpetual production — but to do this, the players must learn to coexist with the forest of Okuizumo or else that won't be able to fire up their tatara.

During the game, players plant trees and harvest other trees that were already on the board. Trees come in different types and grow at different rates, with the planted trees growing somewhat randomly at the end of the round. Players must predict where the forest will grow, while adjusting the balance of their harvesting and planting in order to improve their production.

211963.description:
In general relativity, an event horizon is a space-time boundary beyond which no matter can escape; it is a "point of no return" past which nothing will be the same.

Event Horizon is also the title of this expansion for Exodus: Proxima Centauri. Designed by Rainer Åhlfors and Andrei Novac, it marks a significant step in the Exodus universe!

Exodus: Event Horizon is fully enjoyable when integrated with just the base game of Exodus: Proxima Centauri, but it also works great along with Edge of Extinction, the previously released first expansion for Exodus. Even though all ten modules herein are compatible with one another and can be used together, each represents a new or enhanced experience. While some modules integrate seamlessly, others will surprise and engage you in brand new modes of play.

Module Summary




Bonus Actions

This module adds additional Bonus Action cards as options in your games.



Centaurian Resistance

The Resistance fleets have been reimagined to better scale in both threat and reward throughout the game.



Centaurian Outposts

Centaurians are actively defending their planets against players who exploit their valuable resources.



Exploration

Surprising events and sudden dangers await those brave enough to explore the unknown worlds.



New Planets

New and exotic planets provide even more variety and choices as you expand the reach of your faction.



Proxima Centauri

Our home star makes an appearance in the game and impacts the planetary system with solar wind.



Jump Gates

Utility structures suitable for both strategic and tactical use as well as emergency response.



Communication Satellites

With a strong communication network, your ships will gain an advantage away from home.



Energy Barriers

Natural pockets of energy which can be both a hindrance and a boon.



Leaders

Employ powerful leaders and benefit from their unique strengths.
211963.name: Exodus: Event Horizon

211964.name: To the Last Extremity!: The Siege of Fort Stanwix
211964.description:
To The Last Extremity recreates the 21-day siege of Fort Stanwix in 1777 during The American Revolution. Any number of decisions or events could have altered the outcome, and 'To The Last Extremity' gives players the chance to see what might have been." --from the rule book.

In To The Last Extremity the forces of the fledgling United States of America, consisting of Continental Army infantry and artillery, local militia, and allied Oneida Indian units, face off against the besieging forces consisting of British Army infantry and artillery, Hessian Jägers, Canadian militia, and American Indian allies. Each side receives a deck of cards representing its military forces and the various leaders instrumental in the campaign, such as the American commander, Col. Peter Gansevoort, and the British commander, Brig. Gen. Barry St. Leger, plus many others (including American Indian leaders and Benedict Arnold before he turned traitor!).

Players face off on opposite sides of a period map of the area surrounding Fort Stanwix. At the beginning of each turn, the American player will roll to see if a Chance card is drawn. Chance cards introduce historical events into the game and their effects on one or both sides. The rule book has detailed historical descriptions of each event, which are informational only, but help to bring the history and drama of the Siege of Fort Stanwix to life. Following a possible Chance card draw, players will secretly assign forces and leaders to each of the four sides of Fort Stanwix: north, south, east, and west. How the players choose to distribute their forces will determine the outcome of the siege. Players then reveal their cards. If the British have assigned forces to assault one or more sides of the fort, players will compare the strengths of the opposing forces on that side and roll a die to determine the resultant casualties and whether a breach of the fortress walls has occurred. If the British achieve two breaches on the same turn, they have taken the fort and win the game. If, after 13 turns, the British fail to take the fort, the outnumbered Americans have broken the siege and have defeated the British.

On each turn, the British may also elect to dig entrenchments to protect their artillery, or bombard or skirmish with sides of the fort to effect American morale.

Easily playable in under an hour, "To The Last Extremity" is a simple wargame that provides a great deal of historical flavor surrounding one of the earliest American victories achieved in U.S. history.

211965.name: Beyond the Firelight Quick-Start Rules: Goody Eleanor
211965.description:
(publisher blurb)

Beyond the Firelight is a tabletop roleplaying game (RPG) of historical horror. It gathers its influences from traditional folklore and stories that kept the people from straying off the moral path or going out at night. It can be a game of investigation or survival as you and your friends attempt to discover what lies beyond the darkness around you.

Beyond the Firelight: Goody Eleanor is a set of quick-start rules designed to introduce the necessary mechanics to the players and get them quickly into a game. It includes:

The basic core mechanics
6 pregenerated Personalities
An introductory Scenario placed in 17th century Massachusetts
Appendix of terminology and failure effects.

211966.description:
This is a Playmat for Camel Up with whirlwind spaces that have special Rules

The space 6,7 and 8 on the race track are considered to be whirlwind spaces.
If a camel or a camel unit leaves space 6, they always moves to space 8.
If a camel or came unit leaves space 7, it always moves to space 6.
(The arrow of the whirlwind indicate the direction the camels move.)
A camel or camel unit may only move from space 8 to space 9, only if at least one of the following conditions is met:

a)There is another camel or camel unit on a whirlwind space(6,7 or 8);
b)All other camels are already on space 9 or beyond.

If no condition is met, the camel or camel unit moves backwards to space 7.
Form 7 it will move to space 6 with its next step.
If it gets back to space 6 it will move again to space 8 with its next movement.
There it needs to check again for the conditions to move forward to space 9.
Important:
You may not place your desert tile on any of the whirlwind spaces (neither oasis side nor mirage side).
211966.name: Camel Up: Grand Prix of the Sahara

211967.name: The Frost Papers
211967.description:
(publisher blurb)

"The Ouija Board of Roleplaying Games" - Occult Victorian parlor games for those who love paranormal investigation and ghost stories. This is the first of the ten...

There is nothing quite like them. The Papers combine elements of live action roleplaying games, mass hypnosis as performed by stage magicians, the guided meditations of Tibetan monks, and séances of turn of the century spiritual mediums.

Each game promises an immersive night of supernatural exploration for you and group of friends, placing you at the center of a real life ghost story.

The games are each unique, guiding you through a series of séance-like paranormal investigations.

Each of the ten games is connected to the next, following the story of the mysterious Mr. Frost and his own experiments over a hundred years ago.

They let you follow his footsteps as carefully as you can to unveil clues about the strange realm called the Grey beyond the Fog and the Shadowman that stalks it.

There are no scripts, no actors, and no props. These games provide you the framework to have genuine frightening experiences heavy with occult and supernatural theme.

It’s the closest thing to being in a supernatural horror movie you’ll ever experience.

(user note)

Collects a mixture of previously published and new narrative games.

211969.name: Just Dance 2017
211969.description:
As in previous installments, players must mimic the routine of an on-screen dancer to a chosen song, scoring points based on their accuracy. For input, the game supports either the respective motion controller system for a particular console platform, or a smartphone with the game's companion mobile app.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Just_Dance_2017 Just Dance 2017]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

211970.name: Orwell
videogamehonor: 2016 The Game Awards Best Impact of the Year Nominee
2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
2017 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Honorable Mention
2017 SXSW Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
211970.description:
Big Brother has arrived - and it’s you. Investigate the lives of citizens to find those responsible for a series of terror attacks. Information from the internet, personal communications and private files are all accessible to you. But, be warned, the information you supply will have consequences.

Source: The Game Website.

211971.name: Party Golf
211971.description:
Party Golf combines simple 2D physics, a procedurally generated world and over a trillion different gameplay combinations.

Source: The Game Website.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211972.name: Flesh Torn Asunder
211972.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

Murder here, murder there, murder everywhere. There is skullduggery afoot in the city of Hochoch as the bodies begin to stack.

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 14, and Part Two of the Turf War series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to Knights of the Watch, Knights of Dispatch, wizards, and members of roguish organizations. This adventure offers teamwork benefits. It is helpful to play SHE5-04: A Cup O'erturned prior to playing this adventure.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211973.name: Brooding Boughs
211973.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

The elves of Celene didn’t mention the latent menace of the forest in your mission briefing. The immense boles of the great trees surround you, with their massive limbs looming overhead. The air is still and oppressive, and the sunlight is dim and wavering down here under the canopy. As you wipe the sweat from your stinging eyes the shrieks and roars of the forest denizens suddenly cease. In the brooding silence, something waits... something with teeth.

A one round Sheldomar Valley Metaregional woodlands adventure for [character levels] 6 - 14, and Part Three of the Secrets of the Suss series.

Racially diverse parties are recommended.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211974.name: Things to Do in Bissel When You're Dead
211974.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

"Chill and numb from head to toe, icy sun with frosty glow. Why’d you go reaching your sorrow? Why’d you go read no tomorrow? Feel your spirit rise with the priest. Feel your body falling to its knees. Take your walk of remorse, take your body to a corpse," excerpt from Behind the Wall of Sleep, by Black Sabbath.

A Sheldomar Valley meta-regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 14, and Part Two of the Shadows over Sheldomar series.

Note: Players of characters with evil emanations or physical deformities such as alienists, dragon disciples, etc. will not be allowed to participate in this adventure unless steps are made to disguise themselves. [Characters] Wanted or Banned from the Kingdom of Keoland or who carry the disfavor of the Court of the Land are likewise prohibited from play in this adventure.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211975.name: A Book Unburned
211975.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

The Knights of the Watch have asked the elven merchant Parwyn Amastacia to bring a package from Tringlee to Hochoch, but fear he has been waylaid. Can you help find him? Investigative [characters] wanted. It is helpful to play SHE5-04: A Cup O'erturned and SHE6-01: Flesh Torn Asunder prior to playing this adventure.

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 14, and Part Three of the Turf War series.

Note: This adventure is of particular interest to Knights of the Watch, Knights of Dispatch, elves, and friends of elves.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211976.name: Into the Unknown
211976.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

The Sior Kerrita is an Old Faith festival held every seven years in the County of Ulek. It commemorates the day a hundred years ago when centaurs from the Silverwood came to the rescue of the good people of the County when they were attacked by hobgoblins from the Lortmils. The long years of peace since those dark days make the festival a happy and profitable occasion. But some say there is a darker side...

An investigative Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 8 - 16, and Part One of the Unknown Series.

Centaur [characters] are accommodated in this adventure.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211977.name: Steeped In Atrocity
211977.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

"...most certainly feel a palpable sense of accomplishment as another year of success and growth is recorded. Our able magistar has routed the forces of a mixed elven and dwarven force, and most have already passed though the slave dockets, filling our coffers to bursting. To all intents, our rule in this backwater region is unopposed. The Hartur prophesy of great clan power comes swiftly now to fruition, as none can resist our new-found might! Indeed, just last week a...," excerpted from a water damaged scroll inscribed by one Vandac Hartur, Historian, recovered from the Jewel river delta in CY 527.

A two-round Sheldomar Valley metaregional woodlands adventure for [character levels] 10 - 14, and Part Four of the Secrets of the Suss series.

Racially diverse parties are recommended.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211978.name: Sight Unseen
211978.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

Tensions between rival political and religious factions in the stinking city of Westkeep threaten the fragile peace. Subtle and dangerous conspiracies foment just out of sight, threatening to destabilize the entire area. Surely there is a need for heroes at a time like this…but when one’s enemies hide behind a thousand masks of innocence, where does one even begin?

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 10, and Part One of the Not One of Us series.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211979.name: Three to One's Wonder
211979.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

The Knights appear to have the upper hand against the Triumvirate and the fortunes of good appear to be on the rise. So when is the other shoe going to drop?

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 8 - 14, and Part Four of the Turf War series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to Knights of the Watch and Knights of Dispatch and all spellcasters.

211980.name: No Thank You, Evil!: Story, Please!
211980.description:
Description from the publisher:

No Thank You, Evil!: Story, Please! is a one hundred-card deck stuffed full of evocative art and creative ideas, letting you quickly build hundreds of unique adventures for No Thank You, Evil!

To use these new cards, combine an engaging STORY card with one or more cool PLACE and PERSON cards to outline your quest. Then give your adventure a surprising TWIST, and some cool STUFF. Map and handout cards complete the adventure. The deck is the same size as the cards in the original game, allowing you to use it with the Creature and Cypher Cards from that game.

211981.name: No Thank You, Evil!: Uh-Oh, Monsters!
211981.description:
Description from the publisher:

No Thank You, Evil!: Uh-Oh, Monsters! is an adventure expansion that includes everything you need to run new adventures for No Thank You, Evil!

• Claws and Paws: The Monsters You'll Meet! is a creature book chock-full of monsters, humans, aliens, robots and tons of other walking, talking, fighting, biting creatures you’ll encounter in Storia. Learn more about the Monster Museum, discover quirks, and learn how to make your own monsters.

• Lairs and Scares: Let's Go on Wild Adventures! is an adventure book that offers three brand-new adventures for No Thank You, Evil!, all with fun monster themes.

• 30 new creature cards that match the format of the cards in the original game for quick-and-easy reference.

• 15 creature stand-ups that let you bring creatures to life right at the table!

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211982.name: Dark Whisperer Returned
211982.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

Bad news typically comes in threes and now there are three items of evil loose in the city of Hochoch. Can you find them before anyone uses them? It is essential to play Three to One’s Wonder before playing this scenario.

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 8 - 16, and the conclusion of the Turf War series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to Knights of the Watch, Knights of Dispatch and wizards.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211983.name: Night of Madness
211983.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

It had been thought that all accounts had been settled but apparently a few notations in the ledger had been missed. Missed, but not forgotten. Strange merchants, whispered secrets, and odd excavations have aroused suspicions in Newick. It is possible that services performed have not been repaid and for those merchants of the deepest markets, such a debt cannot be allowed to stand.

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 8 - 16, and Part 1 of the Thousand Eyes series.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211984.name: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
211984.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

The discovery of an ancient temple dedicated to the benign Suel deity Lydia deep in the Jotens has brought together many disparate elements in service to the greater good. A community has been founded, offering the miners and explorers gathered there shelter and rest from their work; such a project also requires adventurers to help keep the darkness at bay. Who knows what threats lurk just outside those comfortable confines?

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 8 - 12, and Part Two of the Not One of Us series.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211985.name: Bones of Contention
211985.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

The "high and the mighty" is how your old pap put it, when discussing the powerful men and women who made things happen and ruled the world. Hard to believe, but you seem to have entered that lofty sphere yourself, and your companions with you. How else to explain why disparate factions of weal and woe dog your heels in a desperate scramble for thaumaturgy that has drawn the attention of the high and mighty in the Sheldomar Valley?

A one-round Sheldomar Valley metaregional woodlands adventure for [character levels] 10 - 14, and Part six of the Secrets of the Suss series.

Racially diverse parties are recommended.

Note: This adventure is of particular interest to [player characters] that are members of the Silent Ones, Seekers, and Knights of Luna meta-organizations.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211986.name: A Topaz is Forever
211986.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

A powerful force is on the verge of being released into the Sheldomar and you have been called upon to prevent it. The mission seems simple enough: infiltrate an impregnable fortress and rub elbows with some of the most powerful villains in the Sheldomar. Will you have the jewels to handle it?

A role-playing intensive, Sheldomar Valley metaregional espionage adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12, and Part Four of the Shadows over the Sheldomar series.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211987.name: Prophecies
211987.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

A Prelate is worried about the priests he sent to investigate a sinkhole that disturbed a graveyard that no one knew was there. Those he sends find far more going on than he suspects. Prophecy is dangerous for all involved; trying to fulfill or decrypt one can have unfortunate consequences – to do so with dozens can be catastrophic.

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 8 - 16.

This adventure can run long, especially at higher [levels].

Note: This adventure is of great interest to Squires and Knights of the Watch and Dispatch and those with the Enmity of the Knights of the Watch and Dispatch.

211988.name: Hot Dogs
211988.description:
It's time for the annual Coney Island Hot Dog Show where competitors worldwide will compete for the coveted title of Wurst In Show!

In Hot Dogs, you will need to craft a variety of frankfurters quickly and accurately using your ingredient cards, but you are working with a head chef that is trying to mess you up. In order to gain a point, you must win one round, take a detriment card and then win the next round. You could say you need to win "at your Wurst point"! If nobody succeeds, the chef scores. Play continues until all players have been chef. To win you have to make 'em fast, make 'em right and do it all before the other players ketchup.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211989.name: Severance
211989.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

A shadow of dread has fallen over the Sheldomar Valley. The fates of nations balance precariously on one man’s secrets. Will you do what is necessary to protect the Sheldomar from its greatest foes? Will you risk all that you hold dear to bring it all to an end?

A challenging Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 10 - 16.

Sequel to SHE7-06: A Topaz is Forever and the part 5 conclusion to the "Shadows over the Sheldomar" series.

This adventure features an optional additional combat encounter at [character levels] 12 - 16.

Warning: This adventure features dangerous challenges, untiered encounters and extreme situations; parties should be well-prepared before embarking on this adventure. Unbalanced parties or parties without arcane spell-casting may find this adventure to be too difficult to complete successfully.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211990.name: A Sight for Sore Eyes
211990.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

Form the introduction:

A plague of blindness and a wave of violence directed at refugee Olman communities all over the Sheldomar Valley have been revealed as a plot by cultists of Tezcatlipoca, the evil Olman deity of light and darkness, to bring back the old ways of sacrifice and subservience. Even now, innocent hostages are gathered for a dark sacrifice, and evil things flock to the banner of the Smoking Mirror. Your guide is the voice of a ten-year-old child, one of many whose death on the altar may bring about the birth of a hideous evil into the world.

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 10 - 14, and Part 3 of the Not One of Us series.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
211991.name: Bloodlines
211991.description:
A Continuous Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Meta-Regional Adventure

Form the introduction:

Dire prophesies move toward fulfillment, and a dark shadow looms over the entire region. Your wits, skill, courage, and might will determine the ultimate fate of the entire Valley. Secrets long held will be revealed, but whether they can survive will depend on the honor and dedication of the heroes and heroines called upon this service. You have come to the city of Hochoch, each for your own reasons, but something has drawn you to this place.

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for [character levels] 8 - 16.

It is recommended that each party have a Knight or Squire of the Watch or Dispatch. The adventure is doable without such a character, but teams with Knights and Squire may have advantages.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of the Knights of the Watch and Dispatch, especially those of the Line of Trilesimain, and anyone concerned with the fate of the Sheldomar Valley.

211992.name: Gods Beyond: Converting Gods of the Fall for Numenera and The Strange
211992.description:
From publisher blurb:

Loot the Afterworld for your Numenera or The Strange game!

Looking for an incredible new recursion for your game of The Strange — or to bring godlike powers into your Numenera campaign? Or maybe you just want to port some new cyphers, character options, and creatures into your game.

Gods of the Fall uses the Cypher System — the same “game engine” that underlies both Numenera and The Strange. Although the settings different, they share fundamental mechanics: task diffculties are rated from 1 to 10; characters use Effort, skills, and assets to reduce that diffculty; and a d20 is rolled to determine success or failure. Characters are described by a single sentence: “I am an adjective noun who verbs”. And although the types, creatures, cyphers, and many descriptors and foci differ from game to game, the form in which they are presented, and the way they fit into the game as a whole, remains the same.

Gods Beyond lets you take full advantage of this commonality, giving you all the tools you need to lift material from Gods of the Fall and drop it seamlessly into Numenera or The Strange.

211993.name: After the Nightfall
211993.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gods Have Fallen — Now It's Your Turn

As fledgling deities, the player characters must undertake divine labors to fulfill their destinies. An ancient text directs them to slay a raver — a creature of profound malignancy. But there are other agendas at play, and what seems like a stepping stone to divinity may prove the characters to be all too mortal.

After the Nightfall is an adventure for the Gods of the Fall setting for the Cypher System. It can be played as a standalone adventure, or it fits neatly into the divine story arc "The Night Beast Awakens" from Gods of the Fall.

211994.name: Copiii Capitanului Grant
211994.description:
The game can be played with 2-6 players
Each player representing one of the main characters from the "Les Enfants du capitaine Grant" novel by Jules Verne: Mary Grant, Robert Grant, Lord Glenarvan, Major Mac Nabbs, Captain John Mangles and Paganel.

The game contains 60 cards with characters (10 cards for each character), 30 value cards (positive and negative), a world map and two plastic figures.

Based on the number of players, a equal number of characters are chosen (there are ten cards for each character) and only these cards will be used in the game.
All these characters cards are shuffled (the total of the caracter cards used it will be ten multiplied by the number of players). Also the value cards are shuffled.

Each player starts the game with ten character cards and five value cards.

The game is played clockwise. The first player put one card from his hand face down. The next player put also a card from his hand face down and then take the card from the previous player and so on.
The scope is to have all the ten cards from a single caracter.
The first player to collect these cards will gain 2000 points.
Bellow are the points for each place:
1 – 2000 points
2 – 1600 points
3 – 1200 points
4 – 800 points
5 – 600 points
6 – 400 points
After that, each player looks at his value cards to calculate the final score. The points from his value cards (can be positive or negative) are added to the points based on his place.
The player with the most points win the game.

211995.name: Kill Game
211995.description:
This game is a chinese version of Mafia / Werewolf.

There are a judge and 8~16 players in this game.
The players consist of Civilians, Killers and Policemen.
The number of Policemen and Killers depends on the total number of players.
8~10 players: 2 Policemen and 2 Killers.
11~14 players: 3 Policemen and 3 Killers.
15~16 players: 4 Policemen and 4 Killers.

Game Goal Policemen: find out Killers and lead Civilians to vote Killers out of the game. Killers: find the Policemen and kill them when it's getting dark. Civilians: help Policemen to vote Killers out of the game. Never ever help Killers on purpose in the game.

211996.description: Drinking Fluxx is a version of Fluxx, the card game with ever-changing rules, with the subject matter of the game being all about drinking and with the game being marketed only to adults.
211996.name: Drinking Fluxx

211997.name: Aaron Allson's Strike Force (Revised)
211997.description:
From the Back of the Book

A superhero setting like no other. A role-playing game campaign book that includes techniques and lessons from over 22 years of play. A tribute to one of the greatest creators in the RPG industry, created using Champions Complete.

This is STRIKE FORCE: The World of Earth AU.

From one of the best-known Superhero RPG campaigns ever comes Aaron Allston's Strike Force: a supplment chock-full of heroes, villains and advice on how how to make our own games especially memorable!

Strike Force can be dropped whole into your campaign, it's teams and histories intact, or you can just pick and choose which elements you'd like to use; the charcters, the techniques, or the experiences an lessons.

Whether you're a newcomer or an old-hand, a gamemaster or a player, Strike force has something for you:


a tribute to one of the great game designers and gamemasters, Aaron Allston
A complete history of a truly multiversal superhero setting.
A look at the universe of Strike Force, known as Earth-AU
More than 30 characters, detailing the heroes and villains of Strike Force
A campaigning section with advice for all stages of a campaign
Techniques for running your own unforgettable superhero RPG campaign including advice from Steve Kenson and Sean Patrick Fannon


Bring your heroes together, stand for justice and enter the world of Strike Force!

211998.description:
A single promotional card. The power of the Xenobiologist is that once per game you can look at your own parasite card.

This card was included in Game Trade Magazine #201.
211998.name: Burkes Gambit: Xenobiologist

211999.name: Project Tingler
211999.description:
User Summary

A blend of classic adventure games and dating sims.

212000.name: The Carnival of Dreams
212000.description:
From the introduction:

It is carnival time in the fabled city of Mirratek, and there is nothing like it in the world.
